datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to exploring remote places, thrill-seeking trips, and backpacking adventures.

columns.name: number_of_trips
columns.description: Number of adventure trips taken to remote areas per year

columns.name: stress_tolerance
columns.description: Ability to handle stress, rated from low to high

columns.name: creativity_score
columns.description: Measured creativity and problem-solving abilities under stress

queries.question: What is the relationship between stress tolerance and creativity score for travelers with different numbers of adventure travel trips per year?
queries.true_hypothesis: Travelers who engage in adventure travel to remote areas more than twice a year have a creativity score that is computed as 3 + 2 * (stress_tolerance)^2  + 1.5 * stress_tolerance if their number of trips is greater than 2; otherwise, it is computed as 3 + 1.75 * stress_tolerance. Stress tolerance plays a significant role in determining creativity scores under stress.
